title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.17 | 09-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So Arjuna is recollecting some past incidents in his intimate relationship with the Supreme Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: Arjuna is remembering past events and his intimate relationship with Krishna, highlighting Krishna's mercy and kindness towards his devotees.

segments.key_quote: The Supreme Lord, the personality of God is Sri Krishna, is the object of worship, both by impersonalists...
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada explains the difference between impersonalists and devotees in their worship of Krishna, highlighting that even impersonalists indirectly worship Krishna's effulgence.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is not only for the devotees or only for the transcendentalists who follow the Vedanta which is the correct philosophy but he is for everyone because everyone is his part and parcel
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna is the source of everything, including the Brahman effulgence, and that He is accessible to everyone as all beings are His parts and parcels.

segments.key_quote: Krishna never forsakes anybody Krishna never disowns anybody Krishna is never away from anyone but we are forgetful
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Krishna is always present and active within every living being, even though we may forget or neglect Him, and that He incarnates to attract everyone through His transcendental pastimes.

segments.key_quote: Intelligent men are attracted by the transcendental acting of the lord with a pure, unalloyed devotee like Arjuna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Krishna engages in intimate relationships with His devotees, facilitated by Yoga Maya, and that devotees are never at fault for engaging with Krishna in this way.
